meanings.definition: To act out a story or situation without speaking, using only gestures and facial expressions.
meanings.sent1: During the game of charades, I enjoy pantomiming different animals for my team to guess.
meanings.sent2: The actor was pantomiming a scene from a famous play on stage.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Sarah entertained everyone by pantomiming a funny skit.
meanings.sent4: His movements were so expressive that it felt like he was pantomiming the emotions of the character.
meanings.sent5: The mime artist captivated the audience by pantomiming a thrilling chase scene.

meanings.definition: The act of performing a story or situation without speaking, using only gestures and facial expressions.
meanings.sent1: The children put on a pantomiming show for their parents in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: Watching a pantomiming performance can be a unique and entertaining experience.
meanings.sent3: The pantomiming contest at the fair had everyone laughing at the creative acts.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for pantomiming made her a popular performer at the local theater.
meanings.sent5: The art of pantomiming requires a great deal of skill and practice to master.
